Key Match Events: Otto López was a triple shy of the cycle.
Connor Norby homered and drove in three runs.
Xavier Edwards and Nick Fortes had two hits each.
Javier Sanoja made his major league debut with a pinch hit appearance.
John McMillon pitched 1 1/3 innings of scoreless relief for the win.
Phillies starter Aaron Nola allowed five runs and nine hits over 4 2/3 innings.
Bride homered to lead off the fifth and put Miami ahead 5-3.
Jesús Sánchez added an RBI single in the sixth.
López hit a solo homer over the center field wall.
Kyle Schwarber hit a tying sacrifice fly in the third inning for his 93rd RBI of the season.
Norby hit a two-run homer in the first to put Miami ahead 2-1.
Marlins starter Darren McCaughan allowed three runs and six hits in 4 2/3 innings.
Post-Match Reflections: Marlins manager Skip Schumaker commented on the team's performance: 'To face one of the better pitchers in the league and one of the better teams in the league was impressive especially with all the moving parts in the clubhouse, meeting new guys.'
Phillies manager Rob Thomson reflected on Nola's performance: 'I think just command of the baseball. He just missed the glove a lot — a lot more than he normally does — and he paid for it.'
Otto López on facing Nola: 'He’s an amazing pitcher and today the plan was let him pitch. His command is amazing so we wanted to stretch out the pitches.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Phillies catcher J.T. Realmuto has some swelling but will remain with the club as he recovers from a left knee contusion.
The Phillies selected the contract of catcher Aramis Garcia from Triple-A Lehigh Valley and designated RHP Nick Nelson for assignment.
Marlins placed RHP Max Meyer and RHP Calvin Faucher on the 15-day injured list and OF Derek Hill on the 10-day injured list.
LHP Andrew Nardi was transferred to the 60-day injured list.
RHP Seth Johnson will make his major league debut for the Phillies on Sunday.
Marlins manager Schumaker mentioned RHP Edward Cabrera could start if he clears all tests after withdrawing from his scheduled start due to migraine-like symptoms.
